column1: full_text
ChatGPT users can now turn off chat history, allowing you to choose which conversations can be used to train our models: https://t.co/0Qi5xV7tLi
We're launching the OpenAI Bug Bounty Program ‚Äî earn cash awards for finding & responsibly reporting security vulnerabilities. https://t.co/p1I3ONzFJK
We‚Äôre sharing details on our approach to safety https://t.co/IRSfIyVxyA

We believe the number of users whose data was actually revealed to someone else is extremely low and we have contacted those who might be impacted. We take this very seriously and are sharing details of our investigation and plan here. 2/2 https://t.co/JwjfbcHr3g

We took ChatGPT offline Monday to fix a bug in an open source library that allowed some users to see titles from other users‚Äô chat history. Our investigation has also found that 1.2% of ChatGPT Plus users might have had personal data revealed to another user. 1/2

We are adding support for plugins to ChatGPT ‚Äî extensions which integrate it with third-party services or allow it to access up-to-date information. We‚Äôre starting small to study real-world use, impact, and safety and alignment challenges: https://t.co/A9epaBBBzx https://t.co/KS5jcFoNhf
Great news! ChatGPT Plus subscriptions are now available in India. Get early access to new features, including GPT-4 today: https://t.co/N6AiifcSXE

Join us at 1 pm PT today for a developer demo livestream showing GPT-4 and its capabilities/limitations: https://t.co/xAg35cWkA5

(comments in Discord: https://t.co/rH899bWeeD)
Announcing GPT-4, a large multimodal model, with our best-ever results on capabilities and alignment: https://t.co/TwLFssyALF https://t.co/lYWwPjZbSg
ChatGPT and Whisper are now available through our API (plus developer policy updates). We ‚ù§Ô∏è developers: https://t.co/vpoyxZ7XnD
How we are planning for AGI: https://t.co/YzqewaYeBH
Information on ChatGPT‚Äôs alignment, plans to improve it, giving users more control, and early thoughts on public input: https://t.co/zA3cVaMzyH
We‚Äôll begin to invite people from the waitlist and will broaden availability beyond the US soon. Join the waitlist here: https://t.co/fd11x9mrG9

We are piloting ChatGPT Plus, a subscription plan that offers faster response times and reliability during peak hours. And of course, the free tier of ChatGPT is still available. https://t.co/2hEBw6h5Se

We‚Äôre developing a new tool to help distinguish between AI-written and human-written text. We‚Äôre releasing an initial version to collect feedback and hope to share improved methods in the future. https://t.co/4dQE3dX6vX
We are happy to announce the next phase of our partnership with Microsoft: https://t.co/mqx3ZJNGfL

We've learned a lot from the ChatGPT research preview and have been making important updates based on user feedback. ChatGPT will be coming to our API and Microsoft's Azure OpenAI Service soon. 

Sign up for updates here: https://t.co/C7kMVpMAKv
We're publishing a report, co-authored with @CSETGeorgetown and @stanfordio, analyzing how language models could be misused for disinformation and how to mitigate those risks. https://t.co/nHiVp7GoxI
Our new embedding model is significantly more capable at language processing and code tasks, cost effective, and simpler to use. https://t.co/Wyba0DZGBF
Try talking with ChatGPT, our new AI system which is optimized for dialogue. Your feedback will help us improve it. https://t.co/sHDm57g3Kr
We‚Äôve just launched the DALL¬∑E API so developers can integrate DALL¬∑E directly into their own apps and products. https://t.co/IMKij5qLSw
We‚Äôve removed the waitlist for DALL¬∑E. Sign up and start creating immediately! https://t.co/TCVDl1iMeU

We've trained a neural net called Whisper that approaches human-level robustness and accuracy on English speech recognition. It performs well even on diverse accents and technical language. Whisper is open source for all to use. https://t.co/ueVywYPEkK
"Eden 3023" ‚Äî Josephine Miller x DALL¬∑E @jemno_ https://t.co/zgm4KLbIy9
‚ÄúThe Diver's Discovery‚Äù ‚Äî Danielle Baskin x DALL¬∑E @djbaskin_images https://t.co/3rgC31T6LI
‚ÄúPlate Runner‚Äù ‚Äî OpenAI designer Chester Cho x DALL¬∑E @_chestercho https://t.co/cfUZXOdDtb

‚ÄúThey Enter Feorm Falorx‚Äù ‚Äî Emma Catnip x DALL¬∑E  
@emmacatnip https://t.co/gKSf6S0SBd
‚ÄúDino, a Most Commendable Doggo‚Äù‚Äî OpenAI research scientist GB x DALL¬∑E @giambattista92 https://t.co/V7ug7bdbwp
‚ÄúEvolution of Man‚Äù ‚Äî  Karen X. Cheng x DALL¬∑E @karenxcheng https://t.co/qCJEKswOHh
‚ÄúAmerican Landscapes: Arizona‚Äù ‚Äî Chad Nelson  x DALL¬∑E https://t.co/iJR0qeQvGZ
"La Vie Lente" ‚Äî OpenAI researcher Tyna Eloundou x DALL¬∑E @ThankYourNiceAI https://t.co/imFzX62siq
DALL¬∑E‚Äôs canvas just got bigger. Expand your creativity with Outpainting: https://t.co/7vyQ42jyyr

Our current roadmap for aligning AI starts with systems that learn from human feedback, uses AI to help humans give better feedback, and eventually involves building AI that can help us do better alignment research: https://t.co/YI0Oi5WQJi
Introducing a free new tool that gives OpenAI API developers stronger content moderation abilities https://t.co/zNB9ax17cv

The OpenAI Residency applications are open! We‚Äôre looking for engineers and researchers who are interested in applying their skills to AI and machine learning. Apply through Sept. 30.

Software Engineering: https://t.co/4RMhCrlIk6
Research: https://t.co/IlIlWgASOA
DALL¬∑E 2 is officially now in beta. We‚Äôll be inviting 1 million people from our waitlist over the coming weeks. https://t.co/MiR3OSbZp9
DALL¬∑E now generates images of people that more accurately reflect the diversity of the world‚Äôs population. https://t.co/m2eOipOfwm

We love seeing what artists are creating with DALL¬∑E.

https://t.co/zxfO4HVTmY
Reducing risks associated with DALL¬∑E 2 before publicly previewing it: https://t.co/Ho4z3xg1OV

We trained a neural network to competently play Minecraft by pre-training on a large unlabeled video dataset of human Minecraft play and a small amount of labeled contractor data. https://t.co/a2pyBqvLvg https://t.co/XbqtwQSTwU
Our latest alignment research looks at ways AI can help humans evaluate language model output more effectively https://t.co/no2fFeDfaS
Techniques for training large neural networks, by @lilianweng and @gdb: https://t.co/S5xDaO9nFN

Join @Miles_Brundage @aidangomezzz @percyliang and @Udi73613335 for a Twitter Spaces discussion in an hour (noon PT) to hear about best practices for deploying large language modelsüëá https://t.co/4jtKw9eWeK
Preliminary best practices for language model providers, authored together with @CohereAI and @AI21Labs. https://t.co/ozh3R4Ef4w
Over 70 Codex-powered apps are now in production across a variety of categories including creativity, learning, productivity, and problem solving. https://t.co/sjPYt77K0t
Update on the DALL¬∑E 2 waitlist: We'll be onboarding up to 1,000 people every week as we continue to enhance our safety systems. https://t.co/k7hrVTw6hc
OpenAI leadership team update: https://t.co/pIujHB7vhC

In our latest blog post, researchers Jacob Hilton and Leo Gao explain how a famous concept from economics relates to Alignment research. 
https://t.co/4qqDleyT5X
‚ÄúA photo of an astronaut riding a horse‚Äù #dalle https://t.co/4UDwErtEbZ
‚ÄúA photo of a quaint flower shop storefront with a pastel green and clean white facade and open door and big window‚Äù #dalle https://t.co/r0DW1PGNwO
‚ÄúA bowl of soup that looks like a monster‚Äù knitted out of wool, made of plasticine and spray painted on a wall #dalle https://t.co/eLHdiVUVGx
‚ÄúAn ibis in the wild, painted in the style of John Audubon‚Äù #dalle https://t.co/YzltjO4o9Q
‚ÄúTeddy bears mixing sparkling chemicals as mad scientists‚Äù in the style of steampunk, a 1990s Saturday morning cartoon, and digital art #dalle https://t.co/6SjCPatC7P
‚ÄúA sea otter in the style of ‚ÄòGirl with a Pearl Earring‚Äô by Johannes Vermeer.‚Äù #dalle https://t.co/tjRMujvj7C
‚ÄúA Shiba Inu dog wearing a beret and black turtleneck‚Äù #dalle https://t.co/VkAsZsNMhY

Here‚Äôs a look at what DALL¬∑E 2 can do. üëÄüßµüëá 

Want to see more? Follow along on Instagram: https://t.co/eKejIFxWdn
Our newest system DALL¬∑E 2 can create realistic images and art from a description in natural language. See it here: https://t.co/Kmjko82YO5 https://t.co/QEh9kWUE8A
GPT-3 can now make changes to existing content, not just predict what comes next. Released in the API today: https://t.co/cDOWJwQeZI https://t.co/jHXsDYcEM0

Deploying and studying the real-world use of language models helps us learn more about safety and misuse than research alone.

As we advance our safety and policy work, we're sharing some of our findings to help others do the same. https://t.co/DcTDvAWxxD

OpenAI‚Äôs mission is to ensure that artificial intelligence benefits all of humanity.

An important part of this effort is training AI systems to align with human intentions and human values.

Learn more about our alignment research: https://t.co/1KsmajXNui https://t.co/ANF9BUlacA

RT @weights_biases: We're excited to announce the new @weights_biases and @OpenAI collaboration!

Add just one line of code to log your GPT‚Ä¶
We trained a neural network that solved two problems from the International Math Olympiad. https://t.co/6OLX3JlccN https://t.co/5WjO8B4GIW
RT @techwraith: Our tests show that @OpenAI is onto something with their new embeddings product. For our real-world use case, it blew away‚Ä¶

We've trained GPT-3 to be more aligned with what humans want: The new InstructGPT models are better at following human intent than a 100x larger model, while also improving safety and truthfulness. https://t.co/rKNpCDAMb2

We're introducing embeddings, a new feature of our API that distills relationships between concepts, sentences, and even code in a simple numerical representation ‚Äî for more powerful search, classification, and recommendations. https://t.co/HXpZL2wJc1

Looking for a way into the field of machine learning? Our OpenAI Residency offers mentorship and a pathway to a full-time role for researchers and engineers who don't currently focus on AI. Applications close this Friday, Jan 14, at the end of the day.¬†https://t.co/8UGqF92aN4
We trained a research version of GPT-3 that can search the web, synthesize information, and cite its sources to provide more accurate answers to questions. https://t.co/YEEazt0oLZ

Developers can now create a custom version of GPT-3 for their applications with a single command. Fine-tuning GPT-3 on your data improves performance for many use cases. See resultsüëá https://t.co/p67QfwbrEa
Over the last three years we've made more than 20 full-time hires through our mentorship programs, representing one in six members of our technical staff. Join us!

We're excited to announce the OpenAI Residency! This new program offers a pathway to a full-time role at OpenAI for researchers and engineers who don't currently focus on AI.

The program will focus on recruiting from underrepresented groups in technology. https://t.co/Umq6ObEeeE
We introduced new safeguards to our API that make it possible to remove the waitlist. Now developers can sign up and explore GPT-3 right away. https://t.co/yj0ROcyHzt

We've trained a system to answer grade-school math problems with double the accuracy of a fine-tuned GPT-3 model.

Multistep reasoning is difficult for today's language models. We present a new technique to help. https://t.co/JRXUYZOSg7

We want our AI systems to be aligned with human intentions.

This is especially important as tasks get more difficult to evaluate.

To develop techniques to address this problem, we trained a model to summarize books. https://t.co/NDnUtcjXFX

We're excited to announce @hlntnr of @CSETGeorgetown is joining our board of directors. Her deep understanding of AI policy will help us achieve our mission to deploy safe and responsible general-purpose AI. https://t.co/NuUxEzEOZq
The Codex Challenge is now closed. Congratulations to the 842 challengers who solved all 5 puzzles! Codex is taking a break after assisting with 23,439 completions.

Apologies to everyone who had trouble accessing the Codex Challenge this morning. We've fixed the servers, and we‚Äôre extending the competition by three hours. You have until 4pm PT to finish. Game on! https://t.co/ZHT14iq7dT
The Codex Challenge servers are currently overloaded due to demand (Codex itself is fine though!). Team is fixing... please stand by.

Talking to Microsoft Word, with OpenAI Codex.

Full video: https://t.co/gJOFHLSDyK https://t.co/lGX8UiJAcv
RT @gdb: Giving Codex a first grade math test: https://t.co/PT7S0Pl7Sh

"Hello World" from OpenAI Codex.

Full video: https://t.co/5YiqVkKYS3 https://t.co/xaD90SuX3n

The Codex Challenge begins at 10am PT tomorrow.

Pre-register now: https://t.co/ZHT14iq7dT https://t.co/Iaxs0I6weT
Prediction: By lowering the barrier to entry to create software, Codex (and future models like it) will make it faster and more worthwhile for people to learn to code. https://t.co/ezF08NqnXR

Data science with OpenAI Codex.

Full video: https://t.co/6bXTPhTjbP https://t.co/BxUybVmiZM
Today's live demo of Codex, our AI that translates natural language to code: https://t.co/MkpiM4W7ow

Announcing a new kind of programming competition.

Race the Internet to solve Python programming puzzles ‚Äî together with Codex as both your teammate & live competitor.

Thursday 10am PT, pre-register now: https://t.co/ZHT14iq7dT https://t.co/OsTndpWtN4

OpenAI Codex has a qualitatively new capability ‚Äî it can write code with sufficient accuracy that users can direct their computer in natural language.

Codex is now in OpenAI API, for people to build new businesses or integrate with existing applications: https://t.co/n3U4DJ7fqC https://t.co/3ETsyXMQ7T
Live demo of OpenAI Codex starting now! Join¬†@gdb, @ilyasut and @woj_zaremba to see our AI's code-writing skills (and their limits) in action: https://t.co/IDxWTCVd7D
Powerful essay by @vauhinivara about loss, grief and finding words for life's most agonizing moments. https://t.co/BpqXOh0ENE
See you tomorrow!üëá https://t.co/Te3ZQsIO3v
Live demo of the next generation of OpenAI Codex, our AI that writes code, on Twitch at 10am PT, Tues Aug 10th. üëÄ https://t.co/CRx0goxVrh https://t.co/ETLdBmb0Xc

We‚Äôre releasing Triton 1.0, an open-source Python-like programming language for writing efficient GPU code. OpenAI researchers with no GPU programming experience have used Triton to produce kernels that are 2x faster than their PyTorch equivalents. https://t.co/bdovUjTMuF

Welcome, @github Copilot ‚Äî the first app powered by OpenAI Codex, a new AI system that translates natural language into code.

Codex will be coming to the API later this summer. https://t.co/T4wlqDtgAz

We've found we can improve AI language model behavior and reduce harmful content by fine-tuning on a small, carefully designed dataset, and we are already incorporating this in our safety efforts. https://t.co/nJISaAyY2M https://t.co/AJe8bgkzRl
We believe AI is the most interesting area for startups right now, and we want to fund ambitious founders building on our API. https://t.co/mOkZP1Fi1r

We're delighted that @HurdOnTheHill is joining our board of directors. His leadership and expertise will help us achieve our shared goal of building AI that benefits all humankind. https://t.co/Vo7VdK4qk8
A thought-provoking, interactive long read by @pamelamishkin, collaborating with GPT-3 to tell a very human story. https://t.co/Qib6l6UjQy

ü§©@askviable uses GPT-3 to give companies useful insights from customer feedback.
üîé@algolia offers GPT-3-powered search that answers customer questions.
üßë‚Äçüé®@studio_fable's interactive stories feature characters in conversation w/ dialogue generated by GPT-3.üëá https://t.co/q2xi2xFpLK

In the 9 months since we launched GPT-3, developers have created extraordinary apps using our API. Today GPT-3's search, conversation, and text completion powers 300 applications focused on new ideas from productivity and education to creativity and games.¬†https://t.co/UGk7yVb1H9
RT @TechCrunch: Writing helper https://t.co/gvdRF1IJGD raises $2.9M in a round led by Craft Ventures https://t.co/QmDRQUA1Bz by @alex

We're participating in WELM/BIG-Bench, a collaborative effort to measure the capabilities and limitations of large language models. You can submit a task for the benchmark and/or workshop here: https://t.co/GenB6bJArm
This discovery is an important step toward understanding the associations and biases that large language models learn during training, so we and other AI practitioners can ultimately make them safer.
We've found that our latest vision model, CLIP, contains neurons that connect images, drawings and text about related concepts. https://t.co/zV6N4yvYcG
Excited to welcome @Create_Labs and @BlackWomenInAI to our developer community! https://t.co/qtStRm3TPd
RT @jeffclune: Thrilled to share that "First return, then explore" appears today in Nature! Go-Explore solves all unsolved Atari games*, en‚Ä¶
OpenAI research scientists use their combined skill and creativity to expand what‚Äôs possible with machine learning. Apply now to join our team and solve impossible problems! https://t.co/QK1XEFO1V9

We‚Äôre looking for research engineers to build and scale AI systems that achieve unprecedented levels of performance. Apply now to join our team and solve impossible problems! 
https://t.co/FeaMzqnw8e

Thinking about a career in AI research? The OpenAI Fellows program is looking for researchers from diverse backgrounds, with or without AI/ML experience, to work on ambitious AI projects. Apply now to join our team and help solve impossible problems! https://t.co/WHOwz6qAHj
Scaling Kubernetes to 7,500 nodes: https://t.co/DSPU3zNufY

We‚Äôve developed two neural networks which have learned by associating text and images. CLIP maps images into categories described in text, and DALL-E creates new images, like this, from text. 

A step toward systems with deeper understanding of the world. https://t.co/rppy6u1zcn https://t.co/MNVlo8LZbV
üéâ Congratulations to the GPT-3 team for earning a Best Paper Award this morning at #NeurIPS2020! https://t.co/Gvc5brkZ5z
Join us at NeurIPS 2020 to learn more about OpenAI's research, including live demos of GPT-3: https://t.co/Gvc5brkZ5z
RT @codeorg: Our new AI video series is HERE! üéâüíªü§ñ Learn from leaders like @SatyaNadella, CEO of @Microsoft, and others at organizations lik‚Ä¶
RT @TechCrunch: OthersideAI raises $2.6M to let GPT-3 write your emails for you https://t.co/i2Dnftby5F | by Devin Coldewey

We've used reinforcement learning from human feedback to train language models for summarization. The resulting models produce better summaries than 10x larger models trained only with supervised learning: https://t.co/Sk31d1CnTu
Applications are now open for our Fall 2020 Scholars program, which supports underrepresented groups in STEM to study deep learning full-time for 6 months. Apply here: https://t.co/pIvZkJXO6p
RT @gdb: We‚Äôve received tens of thousands of applications for access to GPT-3 via our API. We want to serve everyone who wrote in, but it's‚Ä¶

We recognize these issues are complex; as an industry we need to work together to improve the way we tackle them. New projects that expand OpenAI‚Äôs work in these critical areas are underway, building on existing work in the field. Research & product outputs to come. 8/8

We‚Äôre deploying a content filtration system as a starting point to allow a developer to control what content can be returned. Technology alone won't be the answer; we're working with users and our Academic Access partners for a more comprehensive approach. 7/8

Before applications go live, they‚Äôre also subject to a review with the OpenAI team. Our technical enforcement is catching up to our policies, and the process is improving. We still have many policies to create. 6/8
As we gain more experience operating the API in practice we expect to expand and refine these categories. We‚Äôre actively enforcing our terms of use. 5/8

We‚Äôve shared API Usage Guidelines w/ users that include heuristics for safely developing applications. We do not support use cases which may cause physical or mental harm, including but not limited to harassment, intentional deception, radicalization, astroturfing, or spam. 4/8

Generative models can display both overt and diffuse harmful outputs, such as racist, sexist, or otherwise pernicious language. This is an industry-wide issue, making it easy for individual organizations to abdicate or defer responsibility. OpenAI will not. 3/8

We rolled out limited access to the API via a private beta, which is a way for us to understand the challenges of deploying open-ended generative models in the real world, but with mechanisms in place for safety. 2/8

Last month we released an API for developers to build on top of our latest technology: https://t.co/4BaTBWzRtQ. There‚Äôs been a lot of enthusiasm, but a great deal needs to be figured out as we scale up access. Here's how we're thinking about it. 1/8

Over the past 5 months our 3rd class of Scholars researched how GPT-2 represents grammar, measured the interpretability of models trained on Coinrun, predicted epileptic seizures using brain recordings and more: https://t.co/XmKfSgdLB1
We're proud to support the National Research Cloud initiative to direct more computation to academia: https://t.co/gybBQ6tqkZ

We found that just as a large transformer model trained on language can generate coherent text, the same exact model trained on pixel sequences can generate coherent image completions and samples. https://t.co/whREMuBvxx https://t.co/6AGsfx26gM
More details on our blog: https://t.co/v1KmZVY4c8

We're releasing an API for accessing new AI models developed by OpenAI. You can "program" the API in natural language with just a few examples of your task. See how companies are using the API today, or join our waitlist: https://t.co/SvTgaFuTzN https://t.co/uoeeuqpDWR

We're co-organizing two NeurIPS 2020 competitions using Procgen Benchmark and MineRL. We rely heavily on these environments internally for RL research, and we look forward to seeing the progress the community makes in these challenging competitions. https://t.co/ROe3zGAbwC

It‚Äôs not enough for a company to be non-racist or to tweet Black Lives Matter. We want to be actively anti-racist, and to do that we need to make proactive corrections when it comes to sharing space and opportunity. We‚Äôre committed to doing the work. (4/4)

At OpenAI our aim is to ensure that advanced AI systems of the future are built to benefit everyone. That means we need to work harder to diversify our employees too. We‚Äôve not done a good enough job on this to date. (3/4)

We‚Äôre significantly expanding the number of Scholars, and we‚Äôd be excited if all additional slots go to members of the Black community, whom we will heavily recruit. We‚Äôll share details in the coming weeks for this next class of Scholars. (2/4)

We‚Äôve been talking at OpenAI about what we can do to help Black equity. We‚Äôre committing $1M to this cause via direct donations and expanding our Scholars program, which provides educational resources and mentoring to underrepresented groups in AI. (1/4)

Our 3rd cohort of Scholars are wrapping up their final projects and we'd like to connect them with great companies in AI. If you're currently hiring ML researchers/engineers, fill out this form to participate in our (virtual) speed interview day June 17th! https://t.co/gLUq7vAXMV https://t.co/Uwb3ZCa06p

Since 2012, the amount of compute for training to AlexNet-level performance on ImageNet has been decreasing exponentially ‚Äî halving every 16 months, in total a 44x improvement. 

By contrast, Moore's Law would only have yielded an 11x cost improvement: https://t.co/nQnZ4uPXQf https://t.co/vRwfm2UlSq

Introducing Jukebox, a neural net that generates music, including rudimentary singing, as raw audio in a variety of genres and artist styles. We're releasing a tool for everyone to explore the generated samples, as well as the model and code: https://t.co/EUq7hNZv62 https://t.co/sh5yHz7qrc
We've contributed to a multi-stakeholder report by 58 co-authors at 30 organizations that describes 10 mechanisms to improve the verifiability of claims made about AI systems. https://t.co/Wxz0BY3qR5

Introducing OpenAI Microscope: a collection of visualizations of every layer and neuron in eight vision "model organisms" often studied in interpretability. This tool allows researchers to investigate down to individual units, and share those observations. https://t.co/9RxZwc5DOR

We're hiring a senior technical recruiter to join our People Ops team! You'll develop, iterate on, and manage recruiting processes and systems from end-to-end; also source, pitch, screen and close top talent for our research org. Interested? Please apply! https://t.co/EkvMsmNVbK
Want to participate in Circuits? Or just want a sneak peek into the next article? You can join the Distill slack circuits channel at https://t.co/HTxMxjs1cr

This post, called Zoom In, is the first in a new series called Circuits. Over the course of the series, we and our collaborators will flesh out how we think neural nets can be understood and explained.

We show how to read a human-interpretable algorithm from a neural network's weights, by studying the circuits formed by the connections between individual neurons: https://t.co/oX47rfEmqx https://t.co/YPtrowyt5k

OpenAI's multi-agent team is currently hiring research scientists! Interested in multiple, interacting agents, AI-generating algorithms, open-ended algorithms, automatically generating training environments, deep RL, and more? Please apply! https://t.co/LNmyHoe8yp https://t.co/LEsPvr7DHY

We're standardizing OpenAI's deep learning framework on PyTorch to increase our research productivity at scale on GPUs (and have just released a PyTorch version of Spinning Up in Deep RL): https://t.co/OGWFsij4Kb https://t.co/lgvqDdWDoB

We're releasing "Dota 2 with Large Scale Deep Reinforcement Learning", a scientific paper analyzing our findings from our 3-year Dota project: https://t.co/6sMjRNzFXN

One highlight ‚Äî we trained a new agent, Rerun, which has a 98% win rate vs the version that beat @OGEsports. https://t.co/1kWvXwBHHp

A surprising deep learning mystery:

Contrary to conventional wisdom, performance of unregularized CNNs, ResNets, and transformers is non-monotonic: improves, then gets worse, then improves again with increasing model size, data size, or training time.

https://t.co/3PwNElyNC8 https://t.co/Zdox9dbIBv

We're releasing Procgen Benchmark, 16 procedurally-generated environments for measuring how quickly a reinforcement learning agent learns generalizable skills.

This has become the standard research platform used by the OpenAI RL team: https://t.co/jK5uuD9cvL https://t.co/OhECCCAeY3

We're releasing Safety Gym, environments and tools to evaluate reinforcement learning with safety constraints: https://t.co/3fj0at6UVV

Aims to ultimately help agents satisfy real-world safety requirements while training (eg not driving off a cliff, not writing abusive content). https://t.co/VTwS4KoFS1

We've analyzed compute used in major AI results for the past decades and identified two eras in AI:

1) Prior to 2012 - AI results closely tracked Moore's Law, w/ compute doubling every two years. 

2) Post-2012 - compute has been doubling every 3.4 months https://t.co/DsFf0qpp0s https://t.co/ILN5MRrWYH

We're releasing the 1.5billion parameter GPT-2 model as part of our staged release publication strategy.
- GPT-2 output detection model: https://t.co/PX3tbOOOTy
- Research from partners on potential malicious uses: https://t.co/om28yMULL5

In case you missed it, here‚Äôs the unedited solve of the Rubik‚Äôs cube: https://t.co/Lre6otlwWi

Human hands let us solve a wide variety of tasks. Even so, solving a Rubik's Cube one-handed isn't easy for humans. We're excited to continue to develop new AI technology and ultimately ensure that these systems benefit all of humanity. https://t.co/0ntSeJ5ueG
"Solving the Rubik's Cube with a Robot Hand" took many human hands over the past 2.5 years ‚Äî meet our Robotics team! (PS they're hiring: https://t.co/gSCOW9bguI!) https://t.co/jeCUEDtYY3

We‚Äôre all used to robots that fail when their environment changes unpredictably. Our robotic system is adaptable enough to handle unexpected situations not seen during training, such as being prodded by a stuffed giraffe: https://t.co/wBoh1nt9Kv

We've trained an AI system to solve the Rubik's Cube with a human-like robot hand.

This is an unprecedented level of dexterity for a robot, and is hard even for humans to do.

The system trains in an imperfect simulation and quickly adapts to reality: https://t.co/O04izt3KvO https://t.co/8lGhU2pPck

Now accepting applications for our 3rd class of OpenAI Scholars: a 4 month full-time program for individuals from underrepresented groups to study deep learning and produce an open-source project. Mentors include @mcleavey, @karlcobbe, @AlecRad: https://t.co/Xj5qVLi1ph

Wondering why the hiders did not cage in the seekers instead of building their own fort? In one environment variant where hiders have to protect glowing orbs, that's exactly what they learned to do! https://t.co/yifS7rI4eR

We've fine-tuned GPT-2 using human feedback for tasks such as summarizing articles, matching the preferences of human labelers (if not always our own). We're hoping this brings safety methods closer to machines learning values by talking with humans. https://t.co/ok9jeMP5zj
And seekers learn that if they run at a wall with a ramp at the right angle, they can launch themselves upward. https://t.co/SJv9SzctEp

Unexpected and surprising behaviors included box surfing, where seekers learn to bring a box to a locked ramp in order to jump on top of the box and then ‚Äúsurf‚Äù it to the hider‚Äôs shelter. https://t.co/v0kGfCYZna

We've observed AIs discovering complex tool use while competing in a simple game of hide-and-seek. They develop a series of six distinct strategies and counterstrategies, ultimately using tools in the environment to break our simulated physics: https://t.co/2lbOxo19rL

.@sama recently chatted with @kevin_scott in his latest podcast, "Behind the Tech," and shared his thoughts on AI progress, building a mission-driven company, and the future of transformative technologies: https://t.co/MsUh5F85cK

We're releasing a new method to test for model robustness against adversaries not seen during training, and open-sourcing a new metric, UAR (Unforeseen Attack Robustness), which measures how robust a model is to an unanticipated attack: https://t.co/kT376fg4kE https://t.co/8yJdd6oD5T

GPT-2 6-month follow-up: we're releasing the 774M parameter model, an open-source legal doc organizations can use to form model-sharing partnerships, and a technical report about our experience coordinating to form new publication norms: https://t.co/wnLwmRt9jT

Each Thursday at OpenAI is Learning Day: a day where employees have the option to self-study technical skills that will make them better at their job but which aren't being learned from daily work.

A conversation with @sama and @satyanadella about the promise of AGI, the need for massive compute power to make it real, and OpenAI/Microsoft's joint commitment to AI safety: https://t.co/uhjCeZ02XQ
.@Microsoft is investing $1 billion in and partnering with OpenAI to support us building beneficial AGI: https://t.co/ueiPKAiXfa https://t.co/8Ebu9knHAk

Our newest policy research analyzes the game theory of industry cooperation on AI safety. We found 4 strategies the AI community can use today to enable long-term cooperation: https://t.co/AxMBQwORec https://t.co/VO8NDVeJKJ
